Text: You can download many poses from various mod archives, like The Glamour Dresser and Aether Link, or check out the Directory in our Discord server for pose-related servers!
Tips on the Home Tab will give you tips.
To restore your default appearance, close Anamnesis, then go to another area, ensuring you've forced a loading screen with an area title.
Use [Shift] and [Ctrl] to speed up or slow down the intervals of your rotation/position.
You can change the values of sliders, input boxes, and gizmos with the scroll wheel.
The Anamnesis window can be made transparent in the Settings Panel.
You can change the current theme in the Settings Panel.
Need more actors but have no friends? Use housing NPCs!
The Wiki has useful guides to help you with using Anamnesis.
Game updates will likely break the tool. Please be patient when this happens, and we will have a fix out ASAP.
You can use housing NPCs, Carbuncles, and other NPCs as detailed in the wiki as extra actors.
You can use poses made for other races, but they may require adjustment.
If hair or ears go funny when loading a pose, turn Physics on, then off again.
Make sure you're running Anamnesis as an Administrator.
You can only pose actors while in GPose.
Anamnesis cannot be used for gameplay advantages. If you find an exploit using Anamnesis, please report it to the developers.
You can set skin, skin glow, lip, eye, and hair colour by RGB using the Extended Appearance function.
You can change the time of day and the weather in the 'World' section.
You can change the window size in the Settings Panel.
When it comes to PCs: Friends, Party Members, FC Members and Alliance Raid Members can be manipulated.
If you ever come across a bug that can be reproduced, please file the issue in our GitHub, ensuring you have provided all the steps on how to reproduce the bug.
Going in first-person mode allows you to capture perfect shots where normally the camera would block due to collision!
When using the Pose tab, if you don't have a bone selected, you can use the Transform function to change your actor's scale and position.
Remember to unfreeze time in the GPose menu before trying to change it via Anamnesis.
Don't be afraid to use real life model references to make your pose look more organic and natural.
You can use Advanced Load to load hands and facial expressions from other poses you've made to save time.
If you feel that a pose you made looks off, try replicating it yourself, in real life. You'll realise quite quickly how something should or should not bend if you try it yourself.
You can scale weapons to 0 while in GPose to make them disappear, in case you forgot to hide them earlier.
Try using the Gizmo while posing!
The Gizmo updates in real time, and is based on your camera, so you can easily see what axis you're manipulating at a glance.
When using the Gizmo, if you right-click to lock an axis, you can use the scroll wheel to change the value, and use CTRL/SHIFT to change the speed.
The Anamnesis Wiki has a lot of useful information about using Anamnesis!
The XIV Tools Discord's Wiki channel has many useful links and guides to help you use Anamnesis!
Hold shift while Anamnesis is starting to reset your settings.
Do you use Penumbra, Glamourer, or Brio? Anamnesis has interoperability with these tools!
Anamnesis works well when used in tandem with Ktisis!
